summary: A forgotten citadel of the Dwemer featuring a grand home, merchants and guards.
descriptionHtml:
[b]Background[/b]
Once a proud citadel of the Dwemer, it is now a place of refuge for travelers and adventurers alike.

[b]Description[/b]
To reach this player home you must first travel through the Asaheim Passage, a scenic set of caves. Once on the other side you will discover Asaheim. Like any hold capitol in Skyrim, you will be able to fast travel directly to the Citadel after discovering it. The player home itself however requires a key, which is hidden in a chest somewhere inside the caves. You will also find Journals which offer insight into the Citadel's history. I look forward to reading your feedback, and thanks for stopping by!

[b]Features[/b]
A cleverly situated forge with the same capability as the Skyforge.
Every crafting station you might need.
Guard NPC's.
4 Merchants. (Blacksmith, General Goods Merchant, Spell Merchant, and Alchemist)
Hotspring
Dagger display case
Numerous weapon racks and plaques.
1 Mannequin
Library/Study
Shrine of Kynareth

[b]Installation Instructions[/b]
Simply extract file and place contents into Data directory.
author: Kraten
